column1: Marechal Deodoro is a municipality and an important tourist center of Alagoas
column3: 793 (2005) and its area is 334 km². The town was the first capital of Alagoas state.

column1: The city was founded as Vila Madalena in 1611
column2: and features a number of historical buildings from the colonial period. It was also referred to as Alagoas
column3: or the City of Alagoas. The first president of the Republic of Brazil
column5: was born in Vila Madalena; the city was later renamed in his honour.

column1: Manuel Deodoro da Fonseca — born in the town
Aureliano Cândido Tavares Bastos — born in the town
List of National Historic Heritage of Brazil — three sites in Marechal Deodoro are listed
